screenplay.rawText:
EXT. OUTSIDE JASON’S ART STUDIO - DAY
Jason arrives in his truck, steps out, and immediately notices trash scattered around the dumpster. He vents his frustration about people rummaging through his garbage.
actions: Jason drives up to his art studio.
He parks his truck and jumps out.
Jason notices trash scattered near the dumpster.
He resolves to clean it up later.

lines: Look at this shit! I’m so sick of people going through my trash, and spreading it all over the damn place.
..I’ll clean this up in a bit.

narrative.summary: Jason arrives for Day Two of painting and becomes annoyed by trash scattered around his studio dumpster — a recurring frustration that adds stress to an already high-pressure commission.
narrative.beatPurpose: Show Jason’s rising stress level and humanize his daily obstacles; contrast mundane frustrations with the looming high-stakes contract.
narrative.conflict: Jason vs. unknown dumpster scavengers; Jason vs. stress.
narrative.stakes: Emotional bandwidth and focus — important as he attempts to meet the tight painting deadline.
narrative.outcome: Jason sets frustration aside temporarily so he can continue his work.

revealedBackstory: People frequently go through Jason’s trash — indicating possible homelessness, neighborhood issues, or someone watching him.

continuityLinks: Builds tension as Jason attempts to meet the painting deadline.
Hints at possible surveillance, neighborhood issues, or foreshadowed conflict.

music: Low, slightly comedic frustration cue OR subtle tension drone
cameraIdeas: Low-angle wide shot of Jason stepping out of the truck.
Push-in shot as Jason notices the scattered trash.
